title: Authors and Citation
text: Hijmans R (2025). geodata: Access Geographic Data. R package version 0.6-7, https://rspatial.github.io/geodata/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {geodata: Access Geographic Data},   author = {Robert J. Hijmans},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.6-7},   url = {https://rspatial.github.io/geodata/}, }

title: Access Geographic Data
text: geodata R package downloading geographic data. package facilitates access climate, elevation, soil, crop, species occurrence, administrative boundary data, successor getData() function raster package.

title: Access Geographic Data
text: can install released version geodata CRAN : can install development version geodata github :

title: Marine data — bio_oracle
text: Marine data Bio-Oracle

title: Marine data — bio_oracle
code: bio_oracle(path, var, stat, benthic=FALSE,      depth="Mean", time="Present", rcp, ...)

title: Marine data — bio_oracle
text: path character. Path storing downloaded data. See geodata_path var character. Variable interest. One 'Calcite', 'Chlorophyll', 'Cloud.cover', 'Current.Velocity', 'Diffuse.attenuation', 'Dissolved.oxygen', 'Ice.cover', 'Ice.thickness', 'Iron', 'Light.bottom', 'Nitrate', 'Par', 'pH', 'Phosphate', 'Phytoplankton', 'Primary.productivity', 'Salinity', 'Silicate', 'Temperature' stat character. Statistic interest. One 'Lt.max', 'Lt.min', 'Max', 'Mean', 'Min', 'Range'. "" var "pH" benthic logical. FALSE surface data returned depth character. Either "Min", "Mean", "Max". relevant benthic TRUE time character. Either "Present", "2050" "2100" rcp character. Either "26", "45", "60", "85" ... additional arguments passed download.file

title: Marine data — bio_oracle
text: SpatRaster

title: Marine data — bio_oracle
text: Assis, J., Tyberghein, L., Bosh, S., Verbruggen, H., Serrão, E.., & De Clerck, O. (2017). Bio-ORACLE v2.0: Extending marine data layers bioclimatic modelling. Global Ecology Biogeography 27: 277-284.

title: Marine data — bio_oracle
code: # \donttest{ # this is a large download x <- bio_oracle(path=tempdir(), "Salinity", "Max",      benthic=TRUE, depth="Mean", time="Present") # }

title: CMIP6 climate model data — cmip6
text: Download downscaled calibrated CMIP6 climate data projected future climates. Either entire world 30 degrees tile. information see https://www.worldclim.org/

title: CMIP6 climate model data — cmip6
code: cmip6_world(model, ssp, time, var, res, path, ...)  cmip6_tile(lon, lat, model, ssp, time, var, path, ...)

title: CMIP6 climate model data — cmip6
text: model character. Climate model abbreviation. One "ACCESS-CM2", "ACCESS-ESM1-5", "AWI-CM-1-1-MR", "BCC-CSM2-MR", "CanESM5", "CanESM5-CanOE", "CMCC-ESM2", "CNRM-CM6-1", "CNRM-CM6-1-HR", "CNRM-ESM2-1", "EC-Earth3-Veg", "EC-Earth3-Veg-LR", "FIO-ESM-2-0", "GFDL-ESM4", "GISS-E2-1-G", "GISS-E2-1-H", "HadGEM3-GC31-LL", "INM-CM4-8", "INM-CM5-0", "IPSL-CM6A-LR", "MIROC-ES2L", "MIROC6", "MPI-ESM1-2-HR", "MPI-ESM1-2-LR", "MRI-ESM2-0", "UKESM1-0-LL" ssp character. valid Shared Socio-economic Pathway code: "126", "245", "370" "585" time character. valid time period. One "2021-2040", "2041-2060", "2061-2080" var character. Variables name. One "tmin", "tmax", "prec" "bioc" res numeric. Spatial resolution. One 10, 5, 2.5 0.5 (minutes degree). Silently ignored provided cmip6_tile(), available res=0.5 path character. Path storing downloaded data. See geodata_path ... additional arguments passed download.file lon numeric. Longitude lat numeric. Latitude

title: CMIP6 climate model data — cmip6
text: SpatRaster

title: CMIP6 climate model data — cmip6
code: # \donttest{ # download of large files takes a while tmin10 <- cmip6_world("CNRM-CM6-1", "585", "2061-2080",            var="tmin", res=10, path=tempdir()) # }

text: Get country codes countries world.

title: Get country codes — country_codes
code: cc <- country_codes() head(cc) #>                    NAME ISO3 ISO2       NAME_ISO       NAME_FAO #> 1           Afghanistan  AFG   AF    AFGHANISTAN    Afghanistan #> 2 Akrotiri and Dhekelia  XAD <NA>           <NA>           <NA> #> 3                 Åland  ALA   AX  ÅLAND ISLANDS           <NA> #> 4               Albania  ALB   AL        ALBANIA        Albania #> 5               Algeria  DZA   DZ        ALGERIA        Algeria #> 6        American Samoa  ASM   AS AMERICAN SAMOA American Samoa #>              NAME_LOCAL      SOVEREIGN       UNREGION1 UNREGION2 continent #> 1           Afghanestan    Afghanistan   Southern Asia      Asia      Asia #> 2 Akrotiri and Dhekelia United Kingdom    Western Asia      Asia      Asia #> 3                 Åland        Finland Northern Europe    Europe    Europe #> 4             Shqiperia        Albania Southern Europe    Europe    Europe #> 5            Al Jaza'ir        Algeria Northern Africa    Africa    Africa #> 6        American Samoa  United States       Polynesia   Oceania   Oceania  p <- country_codes(query="Per") p #>                  NAME ISO3 ISO2 NAME_ISO NAME_FAO        NAME_LOCAL SOVEREIGN #> 4             Albania  ALB   AL  ALBANIA  Albania         Shqiperia   Albania #> 51  Clipperton Island  XCL <NA>     <NA>     <NA> Clipperton Island    France #> 178              Peru  PER   PE     PERU     Peru              Perú      Perú #>           UNREGION1 UNREGION2     continent #> 4   Southern Europe    Europe        Europe #> 51  Central America  Americas North America #> 178   South America  Americas South America

title: Monfreda crop data — crop_monfreda
text: Monfreda global crop data (area, yield) 175 crops. Data may freely used research, study, teaching, must cited appropriately (see ). Re-release data, incorporation data commercial product, allowed explicit permission.

title: Monfreda crop data — crop_monfreda
text: crop character. Crop name(s). See monfredaCrops valid names var character. variable(s) interest. Choose "area_ha" (crop area ha per cell), "area_f" (crop area fraction cell), "area_q" (quality crop area data), "yield" (crop yield Mg/ha), "yield_q" (quality yield data), "prod" (production per grid cell Mg), "" path character. Path storing downloaded data. See geodata_path ... additional arguments passed download.file

title: Monfreda crop data — crop_monfreda
text: SpatRaster

title: Monfreda crop data — crop_monfreda
text: Monfreda, C., N. Ramankutty, J. . Foley (2008), Farming planet: 2. Geographic distribution crop areas, yields, physiological types, net primary production year 2000, Global Biogeochem. Cycles, 22, GB1022, doi:10.1029/2007GB002947.

title: Monfreda crop data — crop_monfreda
code: # \donttest{ # download may take > 5s mcas <- crop_monfreda("cassava", path=tempdir()) #> download failed mcas #> NULL names(mcas) #> NULL # }

title: SPAM crop data — crop_spam
text: SPAM crop data. 42 crops crop groups get 10-minute spatial resolution raster crop area, yield, production value cropping system (rainfed irrigated, subsistence, low-input high-input). global data 2010. Africa dataset 2017.

title: SPAM crop data — crop_spam
text: crop character. See spamCrops valid names var character. variable interest. Must one "yield", "harv_area" (harvested area), "phys_area" (physical area), "prod" (production) "val_prod" (value production) path character. Path storing downloaded data. See geodata_path africa logical. retrieve (date) data Africa instead global data ... additional arguments passed download.file

title: SPAM crop data — crop_spam
text: SpatRaster

title: SPAM crop data — crop_spam
text: International Food Policy Research Institute, 2019. Global Spatially-Disaggregated Crop Production Statistics Data 2010 Version 2.0. https://doi.org/10.7910/DVN/PRFF8V, Harvard Dataverse, V4. International Food Policy Research Institute, 2020. Spatially-Disaggregated Crop Production Statistics Data Africa South Sahara 2017. https://doi.org/10.7910/DVN/FSSKBW, Harvard Dataverse, V3.

title: SPAM crop data — crop_spam
code: # \donttest{ # downloads a large file cas <- crop_spam("cassava", "area", path=tempdir(), TRUE) # }

title: Cropland distribution data — cropland
text: Cropland distribution data 30-seconds spatial resolution three sources: worldcover derived ESA WorldCover data set 0.3-seconds resolution. (License CC 4.0), see https://esa-worldcover.org/en. Values aggregated represent fraction cropland cell. glad derived "Global cropland expansion 21st century" (Potatov et al) data available . Values aggregated resampled. represent fraction cropland cell. five layers representing following years: 2003, 2007, 2011, 2015, 2019. QED cropland distribution data Africa. values probabilities cropland presence estimated neural network trained initial 1-million point Geosurvey conducted 2015. License: CC--SA 4.0; https://.maps.qed.ai/

title: Cropland distribution data — cropland
text: source character. One "WorldCover", "GLAD", "QED" path character. Path storing downloaded data. See geodata_path year numeric. Optional GLAD dataset get data single year. One 2003, 2007, 2011, 2015, 2019 ... additional arguments passed download.file

title: Cropland distribution data — cropland
text: SpatRaster

title: Cropland distribution data — cropland
text: WorldCover: Zanaga, D., Van De Kerchove, R., De Keersmaecker, W., Souverijns, N., Brockmann, C., Quast, R., Wevers, J., Grosu, ., Paccini, ., Vergnaud, S., Cartus, O., Santoro, M., Fritz, S., Georgieva, ., Lesiv, M., Carter, S., Herold, M., Li, Linlin, Tsendbazar, N.E., Ramoino, F., Arino, O., 2021. ESA WorldCover 10 m 2020 v100. doi:10.5281/zenodo.5571936. GLAD: Potapov, P., S. Turubanova, M.C. Hansen, . Tyukavina, V. Zalles, . Khan, X.-P. Song, . Pickens, Q. Shen, J. Cortez, 2021. Global maps cropland extent change show accelerated cropland expansion twenty-first century. Nature Food. doi:10.1038/s43016-021-00429-z

title: Elevation — elevation
text: Elevation data country. main data source Shuttle Radar Topography Mission (SRTM) , specifically hole-filled CGIAR-SRTM (90 m resolution) https://srtm.csi.cgiar.org/. data available latitudes -60 60. 1 km (30 arc seconds) data aggregated SRTM 90 m resolution data supplemented GTOP30 data high latitudes (>60 degrees).

title: Elevation — elevation
code: elevation_3s(lon, lat, path, ...) elevation_30s(country, path, mask=TRUE, subs="", ...) elevation_global(res, path, ...)

title: Elevation — elevation
text: lon numeric. Longitude lat numeric. Latitude path character. Path storing downloaded data. See geodata_path country character. Country name code mask logical. set grid cells outside country boundaries NA subs character res numeric. Valid resolutions 10, 5, 2.5, 0.5 (minutes degree) ... additional arguments passed download.file

title: Elevation — elevation
text: SpatRaster

title: Human footprint — footprint
text: "human footprint" estimate direct indirect human pressures environment. human pressure measured using eight variables including built-environments, population density, electric power infrastructure, crop lands, pasture lands, roads, railways, navigable waterways. expressed scale 0 (low) 50 (high footprint). See https://www.nature.com/articles/sdata201667 details. original data available : https://sedac.ciesin.columbia.edu/data/collection/wildareas-v3 Data available two years: 1993 2009, terrestrial areas except Antarctica. footprint seas oceans set zero. original data Mollweide projection 1000 m spatial resolution. data available function transformed longitude/latitude grid 30-seconds resolution. Users free use, copy, distribute, transmit, adapt work commercial non-commercial purposes, without restriction, long clear attribution source provided.

title: Human footprint — footprint
text: year character. "1993" "2009" path character. Path storing downloaded data. See geodata_path ... additional arguments passed download.file

title: Human footprint — footprint
text: SpatRaster

title: Human footprint — footprint
text: Venter, O., E. W. Sanderson, . Magrach, J. R. Allan, J. Beher, K. R. Jones, H. P. Possingham, W. F. Laurance, P. Wood, B. M. Fekete, M. . Levy, J. E. Watson. 2016. Sixteen Years Change Global Terrestrial Human Footprint Implications Biodiversity Conservation. Nature Communications 7:12558. https://doi.org/10.1038/ncomms12558.

title: Administrative boundaries — gadm
text: Get administrative boundaries country world. Data read files downloaded necessary.

title: Administrative boundaries — gadm
text: country character. Three-letter ISO code full country name. provide multiple names downloaded rbind-ed together level numeric. level administrative subdivision requested. (starting 0 country, 1 first level subdivision) path character. Path storing downloaded data. See geodata_path version character. Either "latest" GADM version number (can "3.6", "4.0" "4.1") resolution integer indicating level detail. version 4.1. either 1 (high) 2 (low) ... additional arguments passed download.file

title: Administrative boundaries — gadm
text: SpatVector

title: Administrative boundaries — gadm
text: data https://gadm.org

title: Access Geographic Data — geodata-package
text: Functions downloading geographic data use spatial analysis mapping. package facilitates access climate, crops, elevation, land use, soil, species occurrence, accessibility, administrative boundaries data.

title: Set the data path — geodata_path
text: function allows set get default download cache path geodata package. default path ignored set path argument geodata function another value. "factory-fresh" default location downloads returned file.path(rappdirs::user_data_dir(), ".geodata") can set another value function. save default path across sessions, can add line like : options( geodata_default_path = "c://geodata/path") file returned file.path( R.home(), "etc/Rprofile.site") Alternatively, can also set system variable "GEODATA_PATH" desired path.

title: Set the data path — geodata_path
text: path character. Path name geodata download cache data. missing, current default path returned. Use NA restore original value

title: Set the data path — geodata_path
text: character

title: Landcover data — landcover
text: Landcover data 30-seconds spatial resolution () world. Values fraction landcover class cell. values derived ESA WorldCover data set 0.3-seconds resolution. (License CC 4.0). See https://esa-worldcover.org/en information.

title: Landcover data — landcover
text: var character. One "trees", "grassland", "shrubs", "cropland", "built", "bare", "snow", "water", "wetland", "mangroves", "moss" path character. Path storing downloaded data. See geodata_path ... additional arguments passed download.file

ESA WorldCover 10 m 2020 v100. doi:10.5281/zenodo.5571936.

text: SpatVector

title: OpenStreetMap data — osm

title: population density — population
text: year numeric. One 2000, 2005, 2010, 2015, 2020 res numeric. Valid resolutions 10, 5, 2.5, 0.5 (minutes degree) path character. Path storing downloaded data. See geodata_path ... additional arguments passed download.file

title: population density — population
text: SpatRaster

title: population density — population

title: Soil data for Africa — soil_af
text: Download chemical soil properties data Africa different soil depths. spatial resolution 30 arc-seconds (1 km2), aggregated original 250m resolution. recent estimations properties available data sets. See soil_af_isda soil_world. info, see https://web.archive.org/web/20250421195225/https://www.isric.org/projects/soil-property-maps-africa-250-m-resolution data CC-4.0 NC license

title: Soil data for Africa — soil_af
text: var character. Variables name (see Details ). One : "acid-exch", "Al-extr", "Al-exch", "bases-exch", "BDR", "BLKD", "Ca-exch", "CEC", "clay", "coarse", "drain", "ECN", "K-exch", "Mg-exch", "Na-exch", "Ntot", "pH", "sand", "silt", "SOC" depth numeric. One 5, 15, 30, 60, 100, 200. shorthand following depth ranges: 0-5, 5-15, 15-30, 30-60, 60-100, 100-200 cm. one 20, 50 0-20 20-50 cm path character. Path storing downloaded data. See geodata_path ... additional arguments passed download.file

title: Soil data for Africa — soil_af
text: SpatRaster

title: Soil data for Africa — soil_af
text: Hengl T, Heuvelink GBM, Kempen B, Leenaars JGB, Walsh MG, Shepherd KD, et al. (2015) Mapping Soil Properties Africa 250 m Resolution: Random Forests Significantly Improve Current Predictions. PLoS ONE 10(6): e0125814. doi:10.1371/journal.pone.0125814

title: Soil data for Africa — soil_af
code: # \donttest{ # downloads a large file aph <- soil_af(var="ph", depth=5, path=tempdir()) # }

what: Soil elements data for Africa — soil_af_elements
title: Soil elements data for Africa — soil_af_elements
text: Connect download chemical soil element concentration (0-30 cm topsoil) data Africa. spatial resolution 30 arc-seconds (1 km2), aggregated original 250 m spatial resolution. data Open Data Commons Open Database License (ODbL) information, see https://web.archive.org/web/20250421195225/https://www.isric.org/projects/soil-property-maps-africa-250-m-resolution

title: Soil elements data for Africa — soil_af_elements
Soil elements data for Africa — soil_af_elements
text: var character. Variables name. One : "Al", "B", "Ca", "Cu", "Fe", "K", "Mg", "Mn", "N", "Na", "P", "Ptot", "Zn". See Details path character. Path storing downloaded data. See geodata_path ... additional arguments passed download.file

text: SpatRaster

title: Soil elements data for Africa — soil_af_elements

what: iSDA soil data for Africa — soil_af_isda
title: iSDA soil data for Africa — soil_af_isda
text: Download soil data Africa derived iDSA data set. original data aligned aggregated 30 arc-seconds (1 km2). original spatial resolution 30m. info see: https://envirometrix.nl/isdasoil-open-soil-data--africa/ https://zenodo.org/search?page=1&size=20&q=iSDAsoil

title: iSDA soil data for Africa — soil_af_isda
iSDA soil data for Africa — soil_af_isda
text: var character. Name soil variable. one : "Al", "bdr", "clay", "C.tot", "CEC", "Ca", "db.od", "eCEC.f", "Fe", "K", "Mg", "N.tot", "oc", "P", "pH.H2O", "sand", "silt", "S", "texture", "wpg2", "Zn". See Details section depth numeric. One 20 (0-20 cm) 50 (20-50 cm). Ignored var="bdr" depth always 0-200 cm error logical. TRUE error estimates returned path character. Path storing downloaded data. See geodata_path virtual logical. TRUE virtual connection file returned. useful want extract small area without downloading entire raster ... additional arguments passed download.file

title: iSDA soil data for Africa — soil_af_isda
text: SpatRaster

title: iSDA soil data for Africa — soil_af_isda

McGrath, Gifty E. Acquah, Jamie Collinson, Leandro Parente, Mohammadreza Sheykhmousa, Kazuki Saito, Jean-Martial Johnson, Jordan Chamberlin, Francis B.T. Silatsa, Martin Yemefack, John Wendt, Robert . MacMillan, Ichsani Wheeler & Jonathan Crouch, 2021. African soil properties nutrients mapped 30 m spatial resolution using two-scale ensemble machine learning. Scientific Reports 11: 6130.

what: Soil data for water balance computation (Africa only) — soil_af_water
title: Soil data for water balance computation (Africa only) — soil_af_water
text: Download physical soil properties data Africa can used water balance computation. values soil depth 0 30 cm. spatial resolution 30 arc-seconds (1 km2), aggregated original 250m resolution. properties see soil_af, soil_af_elements, soil_af_isda. info, see https://www.isric.org/projects/soil-property-maps-africa-250-m-resolution data CC-4.0 NC license

title: Soil data for water balance computation (Africa only) — soil_af_water
Soil data for water balance computation (Africa only) — soil_af_water
text: var character. Variables name "awcpf23" "pwp". See Details depth character. Either "30cm" "erzd" (effective rooting zone depth maize) path character. Path storing downloaded data. See geodata_path ... additional arguments passed download.file

text: SpatRaster

title: Soil data for water balance computation (Africa only) — soil_af_water
code: # \donttest{ # this downloads a large file tetaS <- soil_af_water(var="tetas", depth="erzd", path=tempdir()) # }

title: Global soil data — soil_world
text: Download global soils data. data derived SoilGRIDS database. data aggregated transformed longitude/latitude coordinate reference system 30-second spatial resolution. See https://www.isric.org/explore/soilgrids info. data license: CC-4.0 Note currently "mean" values 60cm depth available.

title: Global soil data — soil_world
code: soil_world(var, depth, stat="mean", name="", path, vsi=FALSE, ...)

title: Global soil data — soil_world
text: var character. Variables name. One : "bdod", "cfvo", "clay", "nitrogen", "ocd", "ocs", "phh2o", "sand", "silt", "soc", "wrb". See Details depth numeric. One 5, 15, 30, 60, 100, 200. shorthand following depth ranges: 0-5, 5-15, 15-30, 30-60, 60-100, 100-200 cm. Ignored var="wrb" stat character. One "mean", "uncertainty", "Q0.05", "Q0.5", "Q0.95". Ignored var="wrb" name character. One "Acrisols", "Albeluvisols", "Alisols", "Andosols", "Arenosols", "Calcisols", "Cambisols", "Chernozems", "Cryosols", "Durisols", "Ferralsols", "Fluvisols", "Gleysols", "Gypsisols", "Histosols", "Kastanozems", "Leptosols", "Lixisols", "Luvisols", "Nitisols", "Phaeozems", "Planosols", "Plinthosols", "Podzols", "Regosols", "Solonchaks", "Solonetz", "Stagnosols", "Umbrisols", "Vertisols". used var="wrb" path character. Path storing downloaded data. See geodata_path vsi logical. TRUE, virtual connection file used stead download. allows downloading small area subsequently using crop window ... additional arguments passed download.file

what: Download species occurrence data from GBIF — sp_occurrence
title: Download species occurrence data from GBIF — sp_occurrence
text: Download data Global Biodiversity Information Facility (GBIF) data portal. sp_genus returns data.frame species names associated genus. sp_occurrence downloads occurrence records single species. can check number records returned using option download=FALSE. Note can download record number 100,000. avoid getting 100,000 records, can separate queries different geographic areas. automated sp_occurrence_split. function recursively splits area interest smaller areas number records area less 50,000. downloads records saves folder called "gbif". areas evaluated, data combined single file returned data.frame SpatVector). function interrupted, can run , resume left . want download data entire genus, first run sp_genus download data returned species names one one. using function, please first check GBIF data use agreement see note cite data.

title: Download species occurrence data from GBIF — sp_occurrence
code: sp_genus(genus, simple=TRUE, ...)  sp_occurrence(genus, species="", ext=NULL, args=NULL, geo=TRUE,    removeZeros=FALSE, download=TRUE, ntries=5, nrecs=300,    start=1, end=Inf, fixnames=TRUE, sv=FALSE, ...)  sp_occurrence_split(genus, species="", path=".", ext=c(-180,180,-90,90),   args=NULL, geo=TRUE, removeZeros=FALSE, ntries=5, nrecs=300,   fixnames=TRUE, prefix=NULL, sv=FALSE, ...)

title: Download species occurrence data from GBIF — sp_occurrence
text: genus character. genus name species character. species name ext SpatExtent object limit geographic extent records. SpatExtent can created using functions like ext draw args character. Additional arguments refine query. See query parameters http://www.gbif.org/developer/occurrence details geo logical. TRUE, records georeference (longitude latitude values) downloaded removeZeros logical. TRUE, records latitude longitude zero removed geo==TRUE, set NA geo==FALSE. FALSE, records latitude longitude zero removed set NA download logical. TRUE, records downloaded, else number records shown ntries integer. many times function attempt download data, invalid response returned (perhaps GBIF server busy) nrecs integer. many records download single request (max 300)? start integer. Record number start requesting data end integer. Last record request fixnames TRUE unwieldy poorly chosen variable names changed follows. "decimalLatitude" "lat", "decimalLongitude" "lon", "stateProvince" "adm1", "county" "adm2", "countryCode" "ISO2". names "country" replaced common (short form) country name, original values stored "fullCountry" path character. data downloaded (put subdirectory "gbif")? prefix character. prefix downloaded filenames (best left NULL, function use "genus_species" simple logical. TRUE, vector accepted species names returned. Otherwise data.frame much information returned sv logical. TRUE, SpatVector rather data frame returned. ... additional arguments passed download.file

title: Download species occurrence data from GBIF — sp_occurrence
text: data.frame, SpatVector sv=TRUE

title: Download species occurrence data from GBIF — sp_occurrence
text: terms GBIF data user agreement, users download data agree cite DOI. Citation rewards data-publishing institutions individuals provides support sharing open data [1][2]. can get DOI data downloaded creating "derived" dataset. work, need keep "datasetKey" variable dataset.

title: Download species occurrence data from GBIF — sp_occurrence
text: https://www.gbif.org/occurrence https://www.gbif.org/derived-dataset/

title: Download species occurrence data from GBIF — sp_occurrence
code: sp_occurrence("solanum", "acaule", download=FALSE) #> [1] 5056  sp_occurrence("Batrachoseps", "luciae", down=FALSE) #> [1] 2375 g <- sp_occurrence("Batrachoseps", "luciae", geo=TRUE, end=5) #> 5 records found #> 1- #> 5 #> 5 records downloaded #plot(g[, c("lon", "lat")])   ## args #a1 <- sp_occurrence("Elgaria", "multicarinata",  #      args="recordNumber=Robert J. Hijmans RH-2") #a2 <- sp_occurrence("Batrachoseps", "luciae", #      args=c("year=2023", "identifiedBy=Anthony Ye"))  ## year supports "range queries" #a3 <- sp_occurrence("Batrachoseps", "luciae",  #      args=c("year=2020,2023", "identifiedBy=Kuoni W")) #table(a3[,c("year")])
